Detailed Description

The main application object.

Derived from QApplication, this class embodies the main event loop, and owns application-wide settings and objects not directly related to the user interface.

Can be directly accessed using the global pointer dzApp.

Changes in 4.0:
Removed the following progress functions from DzApp:
  • void startProgress();
  • void startProgress();
  • void stepProgress();
  • void updateProgress();
  • QWidget* getProgressInfoWidget();
  • void pauseProgress();
  • void resumeProgress();
  • void finishProgress();
  • void enableProgress();
  • void enableProgressCancel();
  • void cancelProgress();
  • bool progressIsCancelled() const;
  • bool progressIsActive() const;

    Removed the following DzApp helper classes:
  • DzProgressStepEvent
  • DzProgressUpdateEvent
  • DzProgressFinishEvent
  • DzProgressStartEvent
  • DzProgressHold
    The new class DzProgress should be used for all progress functionality.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzApp::GraphicsMode

The current graphical systems available in DAZ Studio

Enumerator:
NoInterface 

No interface or graphical subsystem is initialized

NoInterfaceWithOpenGL 

The OpenGL subsystem is initialized without a user interface

FullInterface 

The user interface and all graphical subsystems are initialized

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzApp::DzApp ( int &  argc,
char **  argv,
bool  useInterface = true,
bool  runAsSlave = false 
)

Creates a new application object - there can only be one DzApp object for an execution, and this is created by the program's main() function.

Parameters:
argc The argument count passed to the program's main() function.
argv The argument array passed to the program's main() function.
useInterface If false, the application is created without an interface, and the interface can not be created for that execution.
runAsSlave If DAZ Studio is being run from another application, set this parameter to true.
See also:
run()
DzApp::~DzApp (  )  [virtual]

void DzApp::clearBusyCursor (  )  [static]

Like QApplication::restoreOverrideCursor(), clears the application-standard busy cursor and returns the mouse cursor to the previous cursor. Match every call to setBusyCursor() with a call to this function.

void DzApp::clearDelayedDeleteStack ( bool  doProgress  )  [slot]

Forces a deletion of all objects currently waiting to be deleted to free up more memory.

Parameters:
doProgress If true, a progress dialog will be shown to the user while the operation is taking place.

Adds an object to the list of items to delete when the application is idle. If the application is not running, the item is deleted immediately.

Parameters:
obj Pointer to the item to delete.

Adds an object to the list of items to delete when the static items of dzcore are cleaned up. If the application does not exist, the item is deleted immediately.

Parameters:
obj Pointer to the item to delete.

bool DzApp::flushLogBuffer (  )  [slot]

Writes any currently buffered log messages to the log file. This is automatically called whenever the log buffer has more than 512 characters of data, but can be called at any time to force all messages to be written out.

QString DzApp::getAbsoluteScriptPath ( const QString &  scriptName  )  const [slot]

Searches in default locations for a script file of the given name, and returns the absolute path to the file if one is found, and an empty string otherwise. A path relative to one of the default script locations can also be used for scriptName. Currently the default locations searched includes the paths returned from DzApp::getGeneratedScriptsPath(), and DzApp::getScriptsPath().

Parameters:
scriptName The name (or relative path) of a script file to find.
Returns:
The absolute path to the located script file, or an empty string is no script was found.

void DzApp::getDiskSpace ( const QString &  path,
qint64 *  totalBytes,
qint64 *  freeBytes 
) const

Retrieves the total and free space available for the disk on which the directory given by path resides.

Parameters:
path The path of the disk to check
totalBytes This will be set to the total size of the disk
freeBytes This will be set to the available size of the disk
Example:
    // get size and available space for the temp directory and write it to the log file
    qint64  totalBytes, freeBytes;
    QString path = dzApp->getTempPath();
    dzApp->getDiskSpace( path, &totalBytes, &freeBytes );
    dzApp->log( QString( "DAZ Studio temp file path: " ) + path );
    dzApp->log( QString( "Total disk size in bytes: %1" ).arg( totalBytes ) );
    dzApp->log( QString( "Available bytes on disk: %1" ).arg( freeBytes ) );

DzVersion DzApp::getVersion (  )  [static]
Returns:
Current product version number packed into 8 bytes. This is a combination of the major version number, minor version number and build number into a single 64-bit unsigned integer. The most significant word is the major version number, the next word is the minor version number, the next word is the sub-minor version number, and the last word is the build number.
QString DzApp::getVersionString (  )  [static]
Returns:
A string representation of the product major and minor version number.

const QString &  startupScriptPath = QString::null 
)

int DzApp::modifierKeyState (  )  const [slot] 
    SHIFT           = 0x02000000
    CTRL            = 0x04000000
    ALT             = 0x08000000
    META            = 0x10000000

    META + SHIFT    = 0x12000000
    META + CTRL     = 0x14000000
    META + ALT      = 0x18000000
    SHIFT + CTRL    = 0x06000000
    SHIFT + ALT     = 0x0A000000
    CTRL + ALT      = 0x0C000000
Returns:
The current modifier key state - this value is a bitwise or of the Qt::Modifier flags for the active keys, if any.

void DzApp::pauseDelayedDelete (  )  [static]

Pauses the idle based deletion of items on the delayed delete stack.

Attention:
Make sure if using this function to pair calls to pauseDelayedDelete with calls to resumeDelayedDelete or memory issues may occur.
DzApp::Platform DzApp::platform (  )  const [slot]

DAZ Studio is intended to be as platform independent as possible, but there are cases where something needs to be done differently on one platform or another. This function provides a simple way to check which platform DAZ Studio is running under.

Returns:
The enumerated value associated with the Platform that DAZ Studio is running under.

Triggers a refresh of the current style sheet for the application.

Parameters:
reReadFromFile If true, the current style sheet is reloaded from disk before the refresh.

void DzApp::restoreDefaults (  ) 

This function removes all registry/INI settings for DAZ Studio, and sets DAZ Studio back to the default factory clean install state. Call this function only if you really mean it!

void DzApp::restoreDefaultTempPath (  )  [slot]

Restores the temporary files directory to the default location.

See also:
setTempPath(), getTempPath()
void DzApp::resumeDelayedDelete (  )  [static]

Resumes the idle based deletion of items on the delayed delete stack.

Attention:
Make sure if using this function to pair calls to pauseDelayedDelete with calls to resumeDelayedDelete or memory issues may occur.
bool DzApp::run ( DzApp::GraphicsMode  mode = DzApp::FullInterface  ) 

Run the main event loop for the application. The only time that you would need to call this function would be if you were loading DAZ Studio from another application. The following code shows a simple case example of how this would be done.

Parameters:
mode The graphics mode to be initialized for the application. These include the full user interface or graphical subsystems, such as OpenGL.
Returns:
true if the application finished execution normally, otherwise, false. 
    DzApp   *dazApp = new DzApp( 0, 0, true, true );

    // Start the application and show the interface. While DAZ Studio is running,
    // its event loop takes over this thread.
    dazApp->run();

    // The DAZ Studio event loop has stopped (the user closed the application).
    // We could now, for instance, query the scene objects and convert the data
    // into a representation used by the calling application.

    // When the application object is deleted, everything else is also freed up (scene objects,
    // interface objects, plug-ins, etc).
    delete dazApp;
DzApp::saveStateScript ( DzScript &  script  )  [signal]

Emitted when the state (startup) script is being saved. Interface items and other components that want to write to save state information in this script should connect to this signal, and add their specific code to the given script.

Parameters:
script The script that will be saved as the startup script.
void DzApp::setBusyCursor (  )  [static]

Like QApplication::setOverrideCursor(), sets the application-standard busy cursor. Match every call to this function with a call to clearBusyCursor() to restore the previous cursor.

Example:
    dzApp->setBusyCursor();
    // ... do something ...
    dzApp->clearBusyCursor();
void DzApp::setLoadSavePath ( const QString &  dir  )  [slot]

Set the default directory for loading or saving files.

Parameters:
dir The default directory for loading/saving files.
Example:
    // set the load/save path to our favorite folder
    dzApp->setLoadSavePath( "c:/MyScenes" );
See also:
getLoadSavePath()
void DzApp::setOpenFileName ( const QString &  filename  ) 

Sets the file name of the file to be opened at startup. This must be called before run() to have any effect. If this file is set, it will be loaded instead of the startup scene.

Parameters:
filename The name of the file to open at startup.
See also:
DzContentMgr::setStartupScene()
bool DzApp::setSkin ( const QString &  fileName  )  [slot]

Sets the current skin used by the application from a file.

Parameters:
fileName The name of the skin file to load. This may be an absolute path, or it may be relative to the resources folder in the application data path, or it may be relative to the application resources folder. An empty string will clear the current skin.
bool DzApp::setStyleDefinition ( const QString &  name  )  [slot]

Sets the current style for the application.

Parameters:
name The name of the style definition to use.
Returns:
true if the application switched to the given style. False if an error occurred.
bool DzApp::setTempPath ( const QString &  tempPath  )  [slot]

Sets the directory path where temporary files are stored. The path provided needs to be an absolute path. A directory will be created at the new location if it does not already exist.

Parameters:
tempPath The path to the new temporary files directory
Returns:
True if the path provided is valid and changing the temporary path succeeded. False if any errors occurred.
See also:
getTempPath(), restoreDefaultTempPath()
void DzApp::showURL ( const QString &  url  )  [slot]

A convenience method for browsing to a given URL.

Example:
    // open the DAZ home page in the user's default browser
    dzApp->showURL( "http://www.daz3d.com/" );

    // open a local html file in the user's browser
    dzApp->showURL( "file://" + dzApp->getDocumentationPath() + "index.html" );
Parameters:
url The url to open in the system's default browser. Be sure to specify the scheme of the url (e.g 'http://' or 'file://').
DzApp::skinChanged (  )  [signal]

Emitted when a new skin is sent on the application.

DzApp::starting (  )  [signal]

Emitted after the application has finished its startup just before the main event loop begins

void DzApp::statusLine ( const QString &  msg,
bool  writeToLog = true 
) [slot]

Display a message in the current status interface.

Example:
    // the message will be displayed in status bar, and written to the log file
    dzApp->statusLine( "Hello World!" );
Parameters:
msg String to be displayed (and logged if logging is enabled)
writeToLog If true, the message will also be written the the log file.
See also:
log()

bool DzApp::writeConfigScript ( QString  filename = QString::null  )  const [slot]
Parameters:
filename The name of the file to save a configuration script to. Saves out a user configuration script to the given filename. If no filename is given, the script is saved to the same file read from in startup(). The run() function calls this at the end of each execution.
Returns:
true if the file was written successfully.
